translated: Ernevi, Axel Harald, assistant minister, Ämål, born on April 16th, 1906 in Tranemo, Älvsborg county, son of the supervisor Axel Herman Andersson and Hildur Maria Olsson. Married to Gertrud Apler in 1936, with children Bengt (born 1939), Göran (born 1941) and Margareta (born 1945). He graduated from high school in 1927, received a bachelor's degree in 1929, a theology degree, practicing theology exam and ordination in 1933. He traveled to Norway in 1932 and 1946, and to Finland in 1942. He was an assistant pastor in Kristinehamn from 1933-1934, an assistant minister there from 1934-1935, a diocesan assistant from 1935-1943, a military pastor in the Värmland Regiment from 1935-1943, and a regimental pastor there from 1940-1945. He has been a minister in Ämål since 1943. He is the secretary of the joint church council and church assembly in Åmål since 1944, chairman of the Israel Missionary Work group in Ämål since 1943, a substitute member of the board for the priests' society of the Karlstad diocese since 1939, a member of the Karlstad diocese youth council since 1946, a substitute in the Karlstad diocese manor board since 1946, chairman of the North Dalsland youth council since 1946, and secretary of the Åmål sponsoring association since 1945. He has written a number of newspaper articles on edifying subjects and has received a silver plaque of merit from the Värmland regiment.
